The 'Little Hocking River' is a small tributary of the Ohio River, long, in
southeastern Ohio in the United States. Via the Ohio River, it is part of the
watershed of the Mississippi River, draining an area of on the unglaciated
portion of the Allegheny Plateau. The river flows for its entire length in
southwestern Washington County; its tributaries also drain a small area of
southeastern Athens County.

The Little Hocking River rises in Fairfield Township between the communities of
Barlow and Bartlett and initially flows southeastward through southwestern
Barlow Township into Dunham Township, where it is dammed to form Veto Lake,
|title=Geographic Names Information System entry for Veto Lake (Feature ID
#1070976) |author=Geographic Names Information System |authorlink=Geographic
Names Information System |accessdate=2010-07-04}} |title=Geographic
Names Information System entry for Veto Lake Dam (Feature ID #1078389)
|author=Geographic Names Information System |authorlink=Geographic Names
Information System |accessdate=2010-07-04}} which is surrounded by the
Veto Lake State Wildlife Area. |title=Geographic Names
Information System entry for Veto Lake Wildlife Area (Feature ID #1050612)
|author=Geographic Names Information System |authorlink=Geographic Names
Information System |accessdate=2010-07-04}} Downstream of Veto Lake, the
river flows southwestward into Belpre Township; near its mouth it turns eastward
and flows into the Ohio River at the community of Little Hocking.

Among the Little Hocking River's tributaries are three with names derived from
that of the main stream: *The 'East Branch Little Hocking River' rises at in
Warren Township and flows southwestward to in Dunham Township.
|title=Geographic Names Information System entry for East Branch Little Hocking
River (Feature ID #1066696) |author=Geographic Names Information System
|authorlink=Geographic Names Information System |accessdate=2010-07-
04}} It is long and drains an
area of . *The 'Little West Branch Little Hocking River' rises
at in Fairfield Township and flows southward through Decatur Township to in
Belpre Township. |title=Geographic Names Information System entry for
Little West Branch Little Hocking River (Feature ID #1042695) |author=Geographic
Names Information System |authorlink=Geographic Names Information System |accessdate=2010-07-
04}} It is long and drains an
area of . *The 'West Branch Little Hocking River' rises at in
near Bartlett in Wesley Township and flows south-southeastward through Fairfield
and Decatur Townships to in Belpre Township. |title=Geographic Names
Information System entry for West Branch Little Hocking River (Feature ID
#1077164) |author=Geographic Names Information System |authorlink=Geographic
Names Information System |accessdate=2010-07-04}} It is long and drains an area of .

According to the Geographic Names Information System, the Little Hocking River
has also been known historically as "Little Hockhocken River," "Little
Hockhockin River," and "Little Hockhocking River."
